text: Erigeron alpiniformis is a rare Arctic species of flowering plants in the daisy family, and one of several plants known by the common name alpine fleabane. It has been found only in Greenland (Kalaallit Nunaat, part of Denmark) and in Labrador and Nunavut in Canada.Biota of North America Program 2014 state-level distribution mapThe International Plant Names Index, Trimorpha borealis Vierh. Erigeron alpiniformis is a short, branching shrub rarely more than 20 cm (8 inches) tall. The inflorescence generally consists of 1 or 2, rarely 3 or 4 flower heads, each head with many small yellow disc florets and surrounded by a ring of 100–200 white or pinkish-purple ray florets.Flora of North America, Erigeron alpiniformis Cronquist ==References== ==External links== *Photo of herbarium specimen at Missouri Botanical Garden, collected in Greenland in 1926, isotype of Erigeron alpiniformis alpiniformis Category:Flora of Nunavut Category:Flora of Labrador Category:Plants described in 1947 Category:Flora of Greenland
